title: Add module arguments to Module and it's subclasses
body_html:
Arguments are key-value pairs that are passed to __init__
and define the module behavior.
Saving this information allows creating new instances
of the same modules, similar to tensor.new_tensor.

All module implementations in PyTorch are changed to support
arguments, with the exception of Container, Sequential,
ModuleList and ParameterList in torch/nn/modules/container.py.

This PR implements feature request #7620.

This PR implements feature request #7620.
body:
Arguments are key-value pairs that are passed to `__init__`
and define the module behavior.
Saving this information allows creating new instances
of the same modules, similar to `tensor.new_tensor`.

All module implementations in PyTorch are changed to support
arguments, with the exception of `Container`, `Sequential`,
`ModuleList` and `ParameterList` in `torch/nn/modules/container.py`.

This PR implements feature request https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/7620.
